loopProfiles.name: Basic Loop
loopProfiles.description: The simplest loop profile. Capillary goes up, moves toward 2nd bond, then goes down. Simple and fast, but prone to swaying.
applications: High-speed production where stability is less critical

loopProfiles.name: Reverse Loop (Low Loop)
loopProfiles.description: Capillary goes up, moves BACKWARDS (away from 2nd bond) to bend the wire, then moves forward. This creates a 'strain hardening' effect at the neck, forcing the wire to stay low.
loopProfiles.path: Up → Move BACKWARDS (away from 2nd bond) → Forward

loopProfiles.name: Double Reverse Loop (Worked Loop)
loopProfiles.description: Path: Up → Reverse → Forward → Reverse again → Forward to destination. Creates an 'M' shaped kink profile providing the highest stability and stiffness. Used in long wires (>3mm) to prevent them from touching each other during plastic molding encapsulation ('Wire Sweep').
loopProfiles.path: Up → Reverse → Forward → Reverse again → Forward to destination

loopProfiles.name: Long Loop
loopProfiles.description: Special algorithms required for wires >5mm. Often uses multiple kinks to stiffen the wire so it doesn't sag under its own weight.
